Progressive exercises can help offset excess energy caused by anxiety or nervousness.

Before the test, sitting outside the exam room, close your eyes.

Starting with your feet, tense the foot muscles for 5 - 8 seconds. Release.

Then inhale through your nose and exhale through your mouth twice.

Next, tense the calve muscles for 5- 8 seconds. Release.

Repeat with the different muscle groups: upper legs, abdomen, arms/hands, shoulders and face/jaw. Taking deep breath between tensing times.

Then tense your whole body and release. This will rid your body of excess energy so keeping you calm.
